projects.title: Global Warming Simulator
projects.description: A 'Game of Life' style simulation of global warming, Each cell represents a part of the world, and each turn the temperature of each cell is affected by its neighbor. Cities create pollution and the wind moves pollution around. The player can change the values of pollution emissions of each cell type, trying to achieve balance.

projects.title: Mailing Automation
projects.description: Dina.co.il is an online shop which sells paintings on order. Each order that is placed is being saved in the site's databases. Every hour the system generates all e-mails for all new orders and sends it to the printing factory. As it was tailored to their needs, there is no need for human involvment anymore, it even adds an image of the required painting! Automation at its best!
projects.fullDescription:
Developed an automated email generation and delivery system for Dina.co.il, a custom painting e-commerce platform. The system automatically processes new orders from the site's database, generates customized emails with the painting images, and sends them directly to the printing factory.

Key Features:
- Automated hourly checks for new orders
- Dynamic email generation with order details
- Image attachment automation
- Error handling and logging
- Zero human intervention required

The automation has significantly reduced manual processing time and eliminated human errors in order communication.

projects.title: Antz
projects.description: A 3D simulation focused on autonomous agents using state-based AI, Ant Colony Optimization (pheromone pathfinding), and a genetic algorithm that drives colony evolution. The player defines the queen’s genome, shaping the behavioral traits of future generations.
projects.fullDescription:
Antz is a 3D simulation exploring decentralized AI systems and evolutionary dynamics within an ant colony.
Rather than directly controlling units, the player influences the system at a genetic level by defining the queen’s genome. From there, behavior emerges autonomously.
Current Implemented Systems
Autonomous Agent AI
Each ant operates using state-based logic
No predefined roles (no workers/soldiers yet)
Ants independently search for food and return it to the nest
Behavior decisions are driven by internal state (energy, environment input)
This creates decentralized behavior without global control logic.
Ant Colony Optimization (ACO) Pathfinding
Pheromone-based pathfinding system
Ants deposit pheromones while traveling
Other ants probabilistically follow stronger pheromone trails
Trails decay over time, allowing dynamic path adaptation
This enables emergent shortest-path discovery without traditional centralized pathfinding algorithms.
Genomic Evolution System
The queen has a configurable genome selected by the player at the start
Genes influence colony traits (e.g., reproduction interval and other evolving parameters)
Offspring inherit genetic traits
Designed to evolve through a genetic algorithm framework
This shifts control from micromanagement to system-level tuning.
Resource & Survival Mechanics
Ants have HP and Energy
Every action consumes energy
When energy reaches zero, HP begins to drop
Food restores energy
Colony survival depends on resource efficiency
This creates natural evolutionary pressure within the simulation.
Queen System
The queen is stationary
She produces broods at intervals determined by her genome
Colony growth rate is genetically controlled
Design Philosophy
This project explores:
Decentralized intelligence
Emergent behavior from simple rules
Evolutionary systems
Swarm algorithms
Simulation over scripted gameplay
Instead of designing fixed mechanics, the goal is to build interacting systems that produce complex behavior organically.
What This Demonstrates
Strong C# architecture in Unity
Implementation of Ant Colony Optimization
Genetic algorithm design and integration
State-machine AI systems
Simulation-oriented systems thinking
Roadmap (Planned)
Role differentiation (workers, scouts, etc.)
Fully editable 3D terrain
Nest construction systems
Player interaction beyond genome selection
Expanded evolutionary pressure and mutation systems
